boardgame.name: La Città
boardgame.description: Set in the Italian countryside, this game features various city-states vying for population. Each player is given two cities to start with, and is charged with expanding the different aspects of the cities to attract larger populations._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players build farms to feed their people, quarries to finance their expansions, marketplaces to allow growth in their cities, and bathhouses to keep their people clean and healthy. Additionally, structures can be built that give the city influence in one of three categories. Superiority in one of these categories will cause population to shift from other nearby cities when the Voice of the People is decided at the end of each turn._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;At the end of six turns, the player with the most victory points, which are determined from well-rounded cities, well-fed populations, and overall size of population, will be the winner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Note: The correct pronunciation is like _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Cheetah_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, but with the accent on the last syllable: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;La Chee-TAH_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2001 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 53a - Mar 6, 2006 - All About La Città (with Jonathan Degann, part 1)
BGTG 53b - Mar 6, 2006 - All About La Città (with Jonathan Degann, part 2)

listing.notes: LA CITTA created by Gerd Fenchel, made by Kosmos, distributed by Rio Grande Games 2000. Original Factory Sealed Game. Shipping weight is 6 pounds.

KOSMOS English edition. Game itself is brand new and still in original shrinkwrap. Unfortunately, two corners have some scuffing, and there is a slight gouge in the back of the box. It actually in NO way affects how the game will look on your shelf. If you are the sort of persn who likes to sit around staring at the back of your game boxes, it might affect you, and you might want to pass on this offer.

Rio Grande Games (RIO 156) Type: City Building Number of players: 2-5 Age of players: 12+ Length: 60-150 minutes Game Description: Each player is an Italian prince and begins the game with two cities. During the game, each playerrquote s goal is to increase the size of the territory he controls by expanding his starting cities and establishing and growing new ones. The players must manage food for their people, as well as health, culture, and education. The player who best manages these things, will win the game. Author: Gerd Fenchel

Still smells new! Extra copy of a great game acquired in a large lot of games. The 150 citizen figures are still factory sealed. This is, obviously, unplayed. Tokens punched, sorted. 100% complete (verified). Heavy, but I use Regional Rate boxes so if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re not too far from Minneapolis it will be pretty cheap to ship. Worst case: flat rate box. Buying several games will SAVE YOU A TON OF MONEY on postage! Big packages work out to $2-3 per game (or less)! *MUST READ* PAYMENT INFO: I take USPS Money Orders or well-concealed cash. I now accept standard Paypal _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Goods Purchase_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; payments under the following terms: The full amount of the Paypal fees (i.e. the fees I will be charged to receive your payment) will be added to your subtotal. Currently this is $0.30 + 2.9% of the full purchase price, INCLUDING the shipping. I also am happy to take ZERO-FEE _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Personal Gift_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; PAYPAL payments that use a bank account or your existing Paypal balance as the payment source (NOT a credit card, unless you pick the option to pay the fees yourselves) for the exact sale price. The _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Personal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; payment feature on Paypal is a little bit buried in the interface, since Paypal doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t make any money off it if the buyer doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t use a credit card and hence doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t want to encourage people to use it. Sending a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Personal Gift_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; does means you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll be trusting your seller (i.e. me) and foregoing (so-called) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Paypal Buyer Protection_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, which is no different than the way every mail order transaction EVER worked prior to 1998 or so. If you are not already aware, in order to make a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Personal Gift_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; via Paypal, you must: Log in to your Paypal account, click _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Send Money_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, click the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Personal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; tab, select Gift and then make sure your source of funds is either your bank account or your paypal account balance. (If you use a credit card, you must select the option to pay the fees [and you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll see why sellers hate paypal fees so darn much].)

Rio Grande Games (RIO156) Each player is an Italian prince and begins the game with two cities. During the game, each playerrquote s goal is to increase the size of the territory he controls by expanding his starting cities and establishing and growing new ones. The players must manage food for their people, as well as health, culture, and education. The player who best manages these things, will win the game.

*Shipping via USPS 3 day priority medium flat rate at $13.65, unless price is cheaper due to proximity of delivery or you request a different service. Set in the Italian countryside, this game features various city-states vying for population. Each player is given two cities to start with, and is charged with expanding the different aspects of the cities to attract larger populations. Players build farms to feed their people, quarries to finance their expansions, marketplaces to allow growth in their cities, and bathhouses to keep their people clean and healthy. Additionally, structures can be built that give the city influence in one of three categories. Superiority in one of these categories will cause population to shift from other nearby cities when the Voice of the People is decided at the end of each turn. At the end of six turns, the player with the most victory points, which are determined from well-rounded cities, well-fed populations, and overall size of population, will be the winner. Note: The correct pronunciation is like _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Cheetah_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, but with the accent on the last syllable: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;La Chee-TAH_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. AWARDS _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; HONORS 2001 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee 2001 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee 2000 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
